g:HTMLPanel.div: Note about motif logos: We enabled Scansite3 to also match quite uncommon amino acids, like Pyrrolysine (O) and Selenocysteine (U) which use the affinities of Lysine (K) and Cysteine (C) if no specific values for these amino acids are given, respectively. In addition, you might notice '$' or '!' in some motif logos: If binding motifs have some preference for an amino acids terminus, '$' is used to represent the N-terminus, and '!' the C-Terminus.
